segment.source: Publishing Virtual Applications Using Application Virtualization Management Servers
segment.target: Publishing Virtual Applications Using Application Virtualization Management Servers

segment.source: Publishing Virtual Applications Using Application Virtualization Management Servers
segment.target: Publishing Virtual Applications Using Application Virtualization Management Servers

segment.source: Publishing Virtual Applications Using Application Virtualization Management Servers
segment.target: Publishing Virtual Applications Using Application Virtualization Management Servers

segment.source: In an Application Virtualization Server-based deployment, virtual application packages that have been sequenced, tested, and found deployable are copied to the main CONTENT share to be used by the Application Virtualization Management Server.
segment.target: In an Application Virtualization Server-based deployment, virtual application packages that have been sequenced, tested, and found deployable are copied to the main CONTENT share to be used by the Application Virtualization Management Server.

segment.source: After the packages are imported on the Application Virtualization Management Server, they can be published to the end users.
segment.target: After the packages are imported on the Application Virtualization Management Server, they can be published to the end users.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The CONTENT share should be located on the server’s attached disk storage.
segment.target: The CONTENT share should be located on the server’s attached disk storage.

segment.source: Using a network storage device such as a SAN or a DFS share should be considered carefully because of the network impact.
segment.target: Using a network storage device such as a SAN or a DFS share should be considered carefully because of the network impact.

segment.source: Applications are provisioned to Active Directory groups.
segment.target: Applications are provisioned to Active Directory groups.

segment.source: Typically, the Application Virtualization administrator will create Active Directory groups for each virtual application to be published and then add the appropriate users to those groups.
segment.target: Typically, the Application Virtualization administrator will create Active Directory groups for each virtual application to be published and then add the appropriate users to those groups.

segment.source: When the users log on to their workstations, the Application Virtualization Client, by default, performs a publishing refresh using the credentials of the logged on user.
segment.target: When the users log on to their workstations, the Application Virtualization Client, by default, performs a publishing refresh using the credentials of the logged on user.

segment.source: The user can then start applications from wherever the shortcuts have been placed.
segment.target: The user can then start applications from wherever the shortcuts have been placed.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization administrator determines where and how many shortcuts are located on the client system during the sequencing of the application.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization administrator determines where and how many shortcuts are located on the client system during the sequencing of the application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A publishing refresh is a call to the Application Virtualization Server that is defined on the Application Virtualization Client, to determine which virtual application shortcuts are sent to the client for use by the end user.
segment.target: A publishing refresh is a call to the Application Virtualization Server that is defined on the Application Virtualization Client, to determine which virtual application shortcuts are sent to the client for use by the end user.
